page.title: 05THE CHURCH - WINDOWS
page.content: The church has a number of interesting stained glass windows. These (like the pews) are mainly Victorian. Two later windows are of particular local interest. The earlier of the two is dedicated to the Rev. Nunn who was vicar from 1850 to 1901. He is the only ghost that is believed to haunt West Pennard. He died peace- fully and is said to be a friendly ghost who looks after the village. His gravestone can be found by the church. There is one modern window given to the church in 1981 by the wife of a man who had sung in the choir for 73 years. The picture shows Christ teaching from a boat but the Tor can clearly be seen in the background. The main altar window suffered some damage in the last war when a bomb fell nearby. The lower part of the window was not replaced.
